content: for about 10 minutes no longer use tongs to remove items from washer to check size if the item needs to continue to felt throw it back in for another 3 - 5 minutes keep doing this until the bag or bowl is the size you want squeeze out the suds to get a good look when it is really tightly felted the piece will feel lighter weight when you achieve the correct size remove items carefully and immediately run it under cold water gently squeeze out as much water as possible lay the bag or bowl on a thick towel stuff the piece with plastic grocery bags until you get the desired shape if the piece has handles it is a good idea to hang the piece for at least part of the drying process turn the piece occasionally and replace the towel as needed it may take a few days to dry depending on the humidity no material in this pattern partial or whole may be reproduced or transmitted by any means without express written permission of designer items made from this pattern are for personal use only and cannot be sold without express written permission of the designer every effort has been made to ensure that this pattern is accurate and complete however i cannot be responsible for differences of individual knitters human or typographical errors please direct any questions or comments to me at conroyungerecht@gmail com ©2012 molly conroy-ungerecht 11 version iii added 2 handled bags and corrected size of bowl bases
